page.title: 03LONGACRE PIG FARM
page.content: {Mr and Mrs Cherry}own{Longacre}pig farm. It was built in 1968 and so is the newest farm we visited. They have 14 acres divided into two fields. At the last count they had 900 pigs. On average they work 10 hours aday from 7.30 am to about 5.30 pm. There are 100 breeding sows, 5 boars,the rest are the offspring. They feed the pigs on pig nuts using 7 tons a week. The pigs live in sheds in warm darkness.Some of the piglets are given special powdered milk as the sow can't feed them.They make 1,000 bales of hay most of which they sell.A fattened pig weighs 50 kilos and sells for Â£60.Mr and Mrs Cherry have lived on this farm for 7 years.Before they owned a farm in Western-Super-Mare.They own a muck spreader and a slurry tanker.
